Articles.Content:
Hi everyone!

I'm pretty new to KSP (and totally new to the forums!) , so thought I'd just say hi, mention a little about where I'm up to (not far lol), and ships I've been using.

I've been playing for about 3 weeks or so. I've managed to get into orbit, start a space station, and get to the Mun... albeit once. My second, third...... and many more attempts failed for some reason. Still getting my head around that.

I tried for eve twice just for the heck of it, got into the same orbit path around Kerbol but then ran out of fuel.... *sigh* Also really struggling to build and land rovers... (-.-; )

Anyhow, here's some pics of my launchers, station modules and space plane. All fairly basic. Was surprised that the plane can reach Mun

Anyway, I look forward to reading the forums and chatting to you in future (*^w^*)

Welcome to the forums Ardia!

You have a pretty nice space station. And here a tip for rovers: Low center of mass, a wide distance between wheels(it will be less roling)
Welcome to ze forums! Honestly, your station is far better than mine and I've been playing this game for years

Thanks for the welcomes, and the rover advice! The main problem I was having is that I think it was too heavy / I ran out of fuel when heading to the Mun, I kept crashing into it instead although one of them was definitely a little top heavy... oops.

Glad you both like the station I wanna make something bigger... like capable of holding at least 4 planes! However I also want to make a Mun base. And explore the solar system, and make huge spacecraft in orbit... and maybe try the kethane mod... so much to do, so little time available each evening . I also want to continue living/breathing and experiencing normal bodily operations... must occasionally remember the real world exists outside of Kerbal Space
